newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka ends firmer on lower dollar demand.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka ends firmer on lower dollar demand.

text.p: The Bangladesh taka closed firmer against the dollar on lower demand for the greenback.
It ended at 42.3750/42.3850 in interbank trading compared with the previous 42.3800/42.3900, dealers said.
The taka opened at 42.3750/42.3900. The market remained mostly quiet and "only negligible amount of deals were done", one dealer said.
Dealers said the interbank call money rates closed at 4.75 to 5.2 percent against 4.5 to 5.2 percent previously.
